intro: Brachyscome squalida, commonly known as the stinkcup, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features small, yellow-orange florets surrounded by a ring of pale blue or white ray florets. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Brachyscome squalida is known for its aromatic leaves, which emit a strong, sometimes unpleasant odor when crushed.
